title: Master Thesis and further material released
excerpt:
Today, we finally released Lukas’ Master Thesis, as well as some other interesting material about HNAP.
Have fun reading!


  Master thesis by Lukas Ostendorf: Design of a Radio Communications Protocol for
HAMNET Access in the 70cm Amateur Radio B...
content:
Today, we finally released Lukas’ Master Thesis, as well as some other interesting material about HNAP.
Have fun reading!


  Master thesis by Lukas Ostendorf: Design of a Radio Communications Protocol for
HAMNET Access in the 70cm Amateur Radio Band
  Presentation: HNAP - The HAMNET Access Protocol
  Article about HNAP (deutsch)
  Talk about HNAP at the Software Defined Radio Academy 2020

title: Recording of the HNAP talk at SDRA 2020 now online!
excerpt:
Today, the recording of Lukas’ talk about HNAP at the HAM RADIO online/SDRA2020
was published on Youtube!



Enjoy watching!
content:
Today, the recording of Lukas’ talk about HNAP at the HAM RADIO online/SDRA2020
was published on Youtube!



Enjoy watching!

title: Article about HNAP in CQ DL magazine
excerpt:
The first part of a german article about “Hamnet auf 70 cm mit dem PlutoSDR” has been published in the magazine CQ DL 7-2020.
We will provide both parts here as soon as the second part has been published in CQ DL 8-2020.
content:
The first part of a german article about “Hamnet auf 70 cm mit dem PlutoSDR” has been published in the magazine CQ DL 7-2020.
We will provide both parts here as soon as the second part has been published in CQ DL 8-2020.

title: Save the date: 28.06.2020 16:00 - HNAP-Talk at SDRA 2020
excerpt:
Lukas will give the talk “HNAP for Pluto-SDR - Implementing the HAMNET Access 
Protocol on the Adalm Pluto SDR” at the Software Defined Radio Academy which 
will be held “online” in 2020:
https://2020.sdra.io/pages/programme.html.
There will be a ...
content:
Lukas will give the talk “HNAP for Pluto-SDR - Implementing the HAMNET Access 
Protocol on the Adalm Pluto SDR” at the Software Defined Radio Academy which 
will be held “online” in 2020:
https://2020.sdra.io/pages/programme.html.
There will be a live chat channel availble to receive comments and questions. Feel free to get in touch.
